reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Winterization assistance for most vulnerable displaced and resident women, men, girls and boys in Afrin and Deir Hasan, NW Syria.

description.narrative: The project aims to provide 6200 HHs of new and protracted IDPs and emergency cases within the host communities with their needs of heating fuel for three months by voucher modality so that each family can choose their preferred type of fuel (diesel, coal or Pomace/olive- pit biomass) according to cluster guidelines (the value of the voucher will be $150 that for each family (which will enable the family to buy at least 120 liters of diesel, 250 Kg of Pomace/olive- pit biomass, or 300Kg of coal each month for 3 months). All households will also have the choice to use a part of the voucher value to get jerrycans, a stove, and its accessories in the first month. Locations were selected to the needs assessment conducted by our MampE team and in accordance with the allocation strategy’s objectives. Thus, 8 underserved communities (Baee, Basufan, Burj Haydar, Kabashin, Fafertein, Afrin (the center), Qarzihel and Tharifa) within Afrin sub-district, Aleppo and one location (Deir Hassan) in Dana subdistrict, Idleb, which are high priorities in this allocation strategy, will be targeted in this intervention. The project will cover the winter needs of 6200 HHs, (85% IDPs and only 15% host community because in these areas the vast majority are IDPs), with a total of 31000 people (5890 men, 6355 women, 9300 boys, and 9455 girls, in a flexible manner so that each family can select the items they need. The project will contract local providers and stores of winterization items so that the beneficiaries can redeem the voucher at their store. Traning on PSEA and GBV and induction about covid19 and project mechanism will be provided to both SDI staff, providers, and their staff in the beginning of the project. The project will aim to hire local staff from both genders thus provide job opportunities for both male and female individuals and contribute to enhancing the local market and operating local businesses. The selection of beneficiaries will ensure gender mainstreaming and reaching PWDs. The project will also focus on community participation and the benefit of all social groups within the community (women, elderly, youth, children and disabled, etc.). To ensure protection and accountability, awareness on covid19, PSEA, complaint mechanism and fire prevention will be provided to all beneficiaries. Winter material provision will be conducted on three batches, the first starts in December 2020, the second in Jan 2021, and the third in Feb 2021.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
